page.title: 17Leisure Activities
page.content: Farmire Fishery, at Farnham, is a privately owned trout fishery. Scotton Village Hall, built in 1977, is the venue for many events, including evening classes, arts and crafts shows, and a weekly Old Tyme Sequence Dancing class. Across the road from the hall is the North Yorkshire County Council Playing Field. Scotton has its own cricket team. Brearton Village Hall is used for Women's Institute meetings, Youth Club and church fundraising events. Footpaths and bridleways in the area are well signposted. Gymkhanas are held at Gibbet Hill Farm, Farnham, in aid of the Royal National Lifeboat Institution.
